findings.title: Potential Unexpected Collision Caused by Unmapped Address of LibStorage
findings.description: There is no predefined addresses for LibStorage s, which may cause unexpected collision on slot 0.

findings.title: jlength Not Updated After a DEX is Removed From the Storage
findings.description: The `jlength` is never updated after a DEX is removed from the storage using `_removeDex(j)`.

findings.title: Diamond Facet Upgrade Could Lead to Inconsistency
findings.description: If during an upgrade `diamondCut(...)` calls are executed in multiple Ethereum transactions, users may be exposed to contracts that are upgraded only partially (i.e., some of the functions are upgraded while others are not). This may result in unexpected inconsistencies.

findings.title: Events Should Be Emitted In Critical Operations
findings.description: Several contracts implement an 'initializer' function without emitting events to track misuse when critical variables are modified.

findings.title: Highly Dependent On Offchain Components
findings.description: The input parameters of functions open to arbitrary end users are generated by offchain components which can be hacked or DDoSed and the data passed in are never checked.

findings.title: Clone-And-Own
findings.description: LiFinance project uses the EIP-2535 standard implementation, but the files have minor differences between them.

findings.title: Two Versions Of Swapper.sol
findings.description: There are two files named `Swapper.sol` with similar functionality, which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior if a contract imports the wrong file.

findings.title: Privileged Roles and Ownership
findings.description: There are some actions that could have important consequences for end-users.

findings.title: Unlocked Pragma
findings.description: Every Solidity file specifies in the header a version number of the format pragma solidity (^)0.8.*. The caret (^) before the version number implies an unlocked pragma, meaning that the compiler will use the specified version and above.
